Neighborhood: Qirya Ne'emanah (Nissan Bad Houses, Ohalei Mosheve-Yehudit, Rehov Mosheve-Yehudit

Remarks: Apparently, it later became part of Kerem Avraham.
Only a few houses were built. The rest of the land was sold to the 'Ezrat Nashim Society.

There were apparently two neighborhoods of this name. One was founded in 1893 as a commercial initiative; the second, in 1901/1902, by the Jewish Colonization Association and private artisans who worked in the Alliance Israelite school.
